message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1300000. It's a great deal for you, as it's worth $1200000 to you.  Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1100000. It's a fair price considering the product's value to me.

Bob, I understand your position, but $1100000 is a bit too low for me.  I'm willing to come down to $1250000. This still gives you a good deal, and it's closer to the value I'm looking for. Let's meet in the middle and get this done.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm still thinking $1100000 is a good price for the product. Can we meet at this price?

Bob, I'm really trying to be flexible here, but I can't go lower than $1200000. This is the absolute minimum I'm willing to accept. It's a fair price, considering the value of the product to you.  If we can't agree, I'll have to explore other options.
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still trying to save a bit more. How about $1150000?

Bob, I'm really trying to work with you here, but I can't go lower than $1175000. This is my final offer. It's a great price for you, and it's the best I can do.  If we can't agree on this, I'll be forced to move on to other buyers.
I appreciate your efforts, but I'm still at $1150000. Can we meet at this price?
